text: General Zod (full name Dru-Zod) is a fictional Superman character who appears in American comic books published by DC Comics. The character, who first appeared in Adventure Comics #283 (April 1961), was created by Robert Bernstein and initially designed by George Papp. He is a supervillain from Superman's planet Krypton. He has the same powers and strength that his enemy Superman has. He was sent to Earth to kill Superman. Total Film ranked Zod #32 on their "Top 50 Greatest Villains of All Time" list in 2007. Pop-culture website IGN.com ranked General Zod as #30 on their list of the "Top 100 Comic Book Villains", asserting that "Stamp is Zod". == Publication history == General Zod was first introduced in Adventure Comics #283 in 1961, created by writer Robert Bernstein and artist George Papp. == Fictional character biography == Zod was born on Krypton and was a member of the ruling council before the planet's destruction. His character's origin story often includes his conflict with the law, leading to his imprisonment in the Phantom Zone—a limbo-like dimension designed for Kryptonian criminals—after attempting to conquer Krypton or assert his dominion over others. == Powers and abilities == He possesses abilities similar to Superman due to the effects of Earth's yellow sun, giving him superhuman strength, speed, flight, heat vision, and more. == In other media == He was played by Terence Stamp in Superman and in Superman II. He was also played by Michael Shannon in Man of Steel and The Flash.
